job description:
Python Data Scientist

New York

Posted Mar 9, 2018 - Requisition No. 65861

Our Team:

We Protect Bloomberg.

As part of the Chief Information Security Office - our Security Analytics team is dedicated to identifying, researching, and solving complex information security problems using a data-centric approach.

Working closely with the security, development, and product teams - we are building a platform to collect, process, and analyze data generated throughout the company to find new approaches to take on hard security challenges.

What's The Role?

As a Python Data Scientist, you'll help research and apply machine learning and statistical methods to solve information security problems. You will also contribute to the development of our data science platform.

We'll Trust You To:

Identify and think about hard to solve information security problems
Collect and curate data needed to understand and solve the problems
Explore, research, describe, and analyze data
Communicate the insights and results of our analysis
Contribute to the development of our data science platform

You'll Need To Have:

Strong conceptual knowledge and background in probability, statistics, and machine learning
Proficiency in Python, with an understanding of what it takes to write high quality code
Familiarity with object oriented programming
Initiative and ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, and collaborative environment with minimum supervision
An interest in Information Security and Computer Science

We'd Love To See:

Advanced degree in a quantitative field, i.e. Mathematics or Statistics
Ability to communicate research results and explaining complex concepts to non-experts
Deep understanding of computer and networking fundamentals
Interest in learning more about our technology stack:
Visualization: D3.js, Sigma.js
Python 3 (numpy, scipy, pandas), R (dplyr, datatable), Jupyter
Javascript, React
Apache, Postgres
Linux

If This Sounds Like You:
